attributes.action: Explain why MPs get three votes on Brexit deal while the British People get none
attributes.additional_details:
Referendum: 23/6/16 
Leave 17,410,742
Remain 16,141,241

MV1: 15/1/19 
432 noes 202 ayes 
MV2: 12/3/19 
391 noes 242 ayes
MV3: 27/3/19 
344 noes 286 ayes
attributes.background: MPs have had three chances in as many months to vote on the PM’s Brexit deal. They’ve continually claimed this deal is “the will of the British People”. Yet the British People have not had a chance to express our will since June 2016. Without taking sides, we’d like parliament to debate and explain.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because we aren't sure what action you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to take.

If you'd like a referendum on EU membership then you could sign a petition about that.
